instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED].001 Current Sense Resistor look like this?
threads.message:
White and Silver?
no polarity I assume?
Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED].001 Current Sense Resistor look like this?
threads.message:
[QUOTE="macitech, post: 18193"]White and Silver?
no polarity I assume?
Thanks[/QUOTE]

- yes
- no

threads.title: [SOLVED].001 Current Sense Resistor look like this?
threads.message: They come in all sorts of colors and sizes, green, black, white. Check board view and schematic for the value. Should of course the same physical size you need. It actually has 4 pins, the 2 small ones go to the sense circuit.

threads.title: [SOLVED].001 Current Sense Resistor look like this?
threads.message:
Thanks Duke!
Machine is up and running.
Doesn't look pretty but it works.
Had problems soldering the resistor on but  used the heat station with the air flow way down under 20%.
Now I have to clean the board and put it back together. Still praying all is well.
Thanks Again!
